status_notes: Case Noted. Thank you for bringing your concern to our attention. Please know that federal criteria in the Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices (MUTCD) prevents cities and towns from installing stop signs for speed control (Section 2B.04). Stop signs installed for speed control have been found to be counterproductive, and have increased mid-block speeds between stop signs and reduced compliance at stop signs. BTD is currently in the process of implementing the Neighborhood Slow Streets program for traffic calming. We are developing an application process so that other neighborhoods can benefit from traffic calming. You can learn more about the program at www.visoinzeroboston.org/nss.

description:
Wren & Oriole: 
Very dangerous intersection with near-misses every single day. This must become a 4-way stop. 
Coming down Wren and turning onto Oriole to the left, or crossing Oriole, is extremely dangerous. As shown in today's picture, cars are often illegally parked, crossing over the "don't park behind here" sign, making it even more difficult to see and creates a need to "shoot out" into the intersection. I know of at least 3 accidents in the past years right here. Because the Oriole St strip from Wren St to Park St is filled with many multi family homes and many are without driveways, Oriole is always packed with parked cars which makes it so difficult to see the cars coming when turning. Lastly, many families walk to school down Wren -- even for pedestrians it's very difficult to see traffic coming from Park St. down Oriole which makes it very dangerous for kids especially. Many of those people driving down Oriole are actually just cutting across the Bellevue hill area, rushed. 
Please consider this a plea for a 4 way stop before another accident happens.
address: Intersection Of Oriole St & Wren St, West Roxbury
